title: Apply Cramer's Rule
text:
Cramer’s Rule is a method that uses determinants to solve systems of equations that have the same number of equations as variables. Consider a system of two linear equations in two variables.
$$a1 x+b1 y+c2 z=d1$$, $$a2 x+b2 y+c2 z=d2$$, $$a3 x+b2 y+c2 z=d3$$. The solution using Cramer’s Rule is given as x=Dx/D,D!=0; ​​y=Dy/D,D!=0; z=Dz/D,D!=0;. If we are solving for $$x$$, the $$x$$ column is replaced with the constant column. If we are solving for $$y$$, the $$y$$ column is replaced with the constant column. Same idea for $$z$$.
D: determinant of the coefficient matrix
Dx: determinant of the numerator in the solution of $$x$$
Dy: determinant of the numerator in the solution of $$y$$
Dz: determinant of the numerator in the solution of $$z$$

title: Find $$x$$
text: Solve for the determinant of the numerator matrix with the constants and coefficients for $$x$$ the divided by that of the denominatior matrix, which are $$x$$, $$y$$, and $$z$$ coefficients.

title: Find $$y$$
text: Solve for the determinant of the numerator matrix with the constants and coefficients for $$y$$ divided by that of the denominatior matrix, which are $$x$$, $$y$$, and $$z$$ coefficients.

title: Find $$z$$
text: Solve for the determinant of the numerator matrix with the constants and coefficients for $$z$$ divided by that of the denominatior matrix, which are $$x$$, $$y$$, $$z$$ coefficients.
